fields.description:
*Issue Summary*

The 'Learn more' link in the 'G Suite' settings page in [admin.atlassian.com|https://admin.atlassian.com/] directs to:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudm/connect-to-g-suite-867172546.html]

This URL is not accessible for users who doesn't have an Atlassian account belonging to Atlassian's domain, and the link should instead direct to:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/connect-to-g-suite-873918510.html]

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Log in admin.atlassian.com
 # Select the Organization and Go to Directory > G Suite
 # Click the 'Learn more' link.

*Expected Results*

The link should open the page [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/connect-to-g-suite-873918510.html]

*Actual Results*

The link opens the page [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudm/connect-to-g-suite-867172546.html].

After logging in you see the message:
{quote}*Looks like we're off the beaten track*
 They say that all roads, lead to Rome. 
 But we've lost our way, so let's try going home.
{quote}
*Workaround*

Use the link below to access the relevant documentation:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/connect-to-g-suite-873918510.html]
fields.summary: Learn more link on the 'G Suite' settings page leads to incorrect page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When connecting to G suite, the user name is synced without a space between first name and last name if it's in Japanese. And Atlassian Access requires the space to recognize the last name when trying to start the trial. So unable to start  Atlassian Access Trial.
* !image-2020-12-02-18-18-21-852.png|thumbnail! 
*  !image-2020-12-02-18-21-06-814.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create user with Japanese name in G suite
 # Connect to G suite
 # go to admin.atlassian.com as the user that created step1
 # Try to start Atlassian Access trial

h3. Expected Results
The user is able to start trial 

h3. Actual Results
The user is not able to start trial due to the error below
* !image-2020-12-02-18-18-21-852.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to start Atlassian Access Trial if it's integrated with G suite and the admin's name is in Japanese

fields.description:

fields.description:
As things are today, only the name and members of the group are able to be synced over SCIM user provisioning.
I would like to suggest that the description be able to be synced as well.

The description being synced will aid users of Jira to better understand the intended purpose of the groups.
fields.summary: Allow syncing group description over SCIM

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We have a documented API endpoint "Get Organizations" that purportedly "Returns a list of your organizations (based on your API key)." However this doesn't make sense on a conceptual level because an API key is scoped to a single organization, so it shouldn't ever return more than one result.

But it actually doesn't return any results. If you use a valid org API key, it returns a 200 response and no data (see screenshot)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an admin API key
 # Make a request to [https://api.atlassian.com/admin/v1/orgs] with API key as bearer token
 # Observe a 200 OK response with the following body:

{code:java}
{"data":[],"links":{"self":"https://api.atlassian.com/admin/v1/orgs"},"meta":null} {code}
h3. Expected Results

This endpoint should probably be removed from the documentation. Alternatively, it should return the metadata for a single organization (which implicitly duplicates the [Get Org by ID endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/api-group-orgs/#api-orgs-orgid-get]) and the documentation should be updated accordingly.

 
h3. Actual Results

See steps to reproduce.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Requests to Get Organizations Admin API endpoint returns authenticated response but not data

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*
When deactivated & accessed revoked users attempt to access Atlassian account, site, or product to which their access is now revoked/deactivated, users are presented with a message advising their account is disabled or access revoked, but users have no simple option to send a request to Org or site admins for their account to be reactivated and access restored.

*Suggested Solution*
Allow the users to send request to Org or site admins for their account to be reactivated and access restored. Apply this solution to all Atlassian products including Atlassian Access, Jira, Conf, Jira Service Management, Trello, Bitbucket, etc.

*Why this is important*
Improved customer experience. Allows org and site admins to restore access more quickly.

*Workaround*
Users must find a way of contacting Org or site-admin to request their access to be restored, in some cases this is done via email or support requests.
fields.summary: Allow deactivated & access revoked users to request Org or site admins to reactivate & restore their access

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Inactive users (with active accounts but not seen for 90+ days) are counted towards Atlassian Access & product bills. This increases billable users and bothers customers. Atlassian docs suggest deactivating or revoking access, to free up licenses and mark users non-billable. However keeping on top of a large user base and periodically searching for users who have not accessed recently, deactivating/revoking the access of those users is a time-consuming activity for Org and site-admins.
h3. Suggested Solution

Automatically class users as non-billable if they have not been seen in the last 90 days. Apply this solution to all Atlassian products including Atlassian Access, Jira, Conf, Jira Service Management, Trello, Bitbucket etc.
h3. Why this is important
 * Allows org and site admins to manage billable users more effectively, by removing the overhead of requiring manual periodic analysis and deactivation/revocation of access of users not seen in the last 90 days.

h3. Workaround
 * Search for a manually deactivate/revoke access of users who have not been seen in the last 90 days, to free up licenses and class users as non-billable.
fields.summary: Mark users as non-billable if user has not accessed for 90 days.
Getting Null from Organization End point

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Some sync error between G Suite and Atlassian is not clear to the admins such as
!image.png|thumbnail!

In that scenario specifically, the issue was that G Suite was trying to push an email update to an account, however, the target email address was already in use by a different Atlassian Account. That gives no clue to the admin what is happening and how they can resolve the issue.

h3. Suggested Solutions
Improve how we handle the error messages in the new G Suite sync. In example:
{quote}
We can proceed and update <account_email_address> to <target_email> because <account_profile_link> is already using that email.  

Note: this does difficulty does not affect the sync of other accounts & groups
{quote}
fields.summary: Improve the error handling with Org-level G Suite integration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * When G Suite presents a sync. error, the error message isn't very descriptive.
!2_gsuitesync.png!

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Include specific information regarding error conditions, e.g.
{noformat}
"Resource [USER]: with email[<email_address>] already exists."
{noformat}
{noformat}
"Resource [USER]: with email already exists."
{noformat}

h3. Why this is important
 * Help G Suite admins determine what the problem is and possibly identify the account which is causing the sync issue
 * Help reduce contact index

h3. Workaround
 * Reach out to Atlassian Support for investigation: [https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/]
fields.summary: Improve error messaging on G Suite configuration page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The managed accounts page slows down when managing a huge number of domain accounts

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Generate 50K Atlassian Accounts under your domain
 # Visit the Managed Accounts page
 # Navigate 

h3. Expected Results

Loading and switching pages should be responsive. 

h3. Actual Results

Loading and switching pages are slowed down.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Managed account page slows down at scale
Inform the admins why they can't remove the SAML SSO configuration when enforced as an authentication policy

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the managed accounts section, Jira core product shows for users without Jira core product in the cloud site

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # After migrating from Server the Jira Core product shows for some users but Jira Core as a product is not present on the cloud site

h3. Expected Results
After migrating from Server the Jira Core product should not show in the user's profile 

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: In the managed accounts section, Jira core product shows for users without Jira core product in the cloud site

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* It's not possible to associate or link the billing details for Atlassian Cloud products such as Trello and Bitbucket to an organization

h3. Suggested Solution
* If the org. admin is also the Team/Workspace admin(and/or billing contact) in Trello or Bitbucket, then show the billing details for those products within the organization UI
* This is already the case with Jira/Confluence:
 !Screenshot 2020-11-13 at 20.04.48.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important
* Allow admins to view billing for their products in a single place
 
h3. Workaround 
* No known workarounds.  A workaround will be added here if a workaround exists
fields.summary: Associate product billing with an organization

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When transferring a new site into an Atlassian Org that have SCIM enabled, the users and groups do not get automatically added.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1. Set up SCIM and sync users into a site
 # Step 2 Create a new site and transfer it into your existing org

h3. Expected Results

The Users and groups are synced automatically into the new site.

h3. Actual Results

There is no sync into the new site

h3. Workaround

Making a change to the users and groups in your IdP may resolve the issue by forcing an update to be sent.
fields.summary: Transferring or adding a new site into an Org with SCIM does not push the users and groups into it

fields.description:
When integrating an IDP with Atlassian Access, some accounts might remain un-synced because the IDP is not actively pushing them to Atlassian. However, those accounts are still billable for Atlassian Access. At the moment, it is not possible to filter out accounts based  on their sync status. 

The filter will allow administrator to action on accounts that gets created via other channels besides provisioning. This is even more relevant for organization with larger user base. 

*Suggestion* :
- In managed accounts, allow to filter accounts based on sync statius
- In managed accounts export, include the sync status.
fields.summary: Ability to filter managed accounts by their sync status

fields.description:
Customers using annual billing currently have no easy way to automate the auditing of license consumption for their known products.
In order to allow the automation of auditing, and notifications centered directly around the consumption of licenses, I would like to propose that the Org REST API include endpoints to allow this information to be accessed by org admins via scripts.

More specifically, being able to get information regarding the associated sites/products, and the consumed licenses per product would be ideal.
fields.summary: Add License Count and Consumption information to Org REST API

fields.description:
In an organization, when [exporting the managed accounts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/export-managed-accounts-964968073.html], the following information will be included, which is very useful for auditing purposes:
{quote} * *Name*
 * *Email*
 * *Status* (whether they're active or a have been deactivated)
 * *Billable* (whether they count towards your Atlassian Access bill)
 * *SAML single sign-on* (whether they log in with SAML sign-on)
 * *Two-step verification enabled* (whether they've enabled two-step verification)
 * *Bitbucket*, *Confluence*, *Jira Core*, *Jira Service Desk*, *Jira Software* (listed with the sites they use to access the products){quote}
For some organizations, it is helpful to know which users are being retrieved via user provisioning or not in order to work with some examples like:
 * Checking if all the users from the directory are being included in the org.
 * Check which users can be manually activated/deactivated directly from the org.
 * Check for users that manually created accounts instead of being retrieved via the company's directory.
 * Remove users manually when they do not belong to the company's directory.

This is a suggestion to include information indicating if the user belongs to the [connected directory via user provisioning|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/user-provisioning-959305316.html].
fields.summary: Include information on users being managed by an identity provider in the export for managed accounts

fields.description:
As an administrator of an organization with [managed accounts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/managed-accounts-873871203.html], the user can change the profile picture of managed accounts and you should be able to see it if the [visiblity settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/update-your-profile-and-visibility-settings-976161175.html] are open for *Everyone* or *Organization*.

However, when the visibility setting is configured to *Only you*, a default avatar will be displayed instead, which is expected because only the users themselves will be able to see their profile pictures. Still, the admin is able to change the profile picture of the account, although it will not be visible.

h3.Improvement request

As the picture will not be visible, in order to improve the user's experience as an administrator, a message stating that the change will take effect but will not be visible should be displayed. For example:

{quote}
Although you can change the profile picture, only X user will be able to see it due to the [Atlassian account visibility settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/update-your-profile-and-visibility-settings-976161175.html] applied to it.
{quote}
fields.summary: Improve the profile picture change via organization according to the user's visiblity settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a site has a Premium subscription for both Jira Service Desk and Jira Software, the "Create Allowlist" pop-ul shows them both, separated, but once the admin clicks on one, the tickbox for the other one is also ticked.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upgrade both JSD and JSW to Premium
 # Create an allowlist

h3. Expected Results
Since an allowlist only differentiates between Jira and Confluence, only one generic "Jira" choice should be displayed

h3. Actual Results

There are 2 Jira choices in the modal, and when ticking the box to one of them, the other's box gets ticked as well:
 !image-2020-10-28-16-17-07-944.png|thumbnail! 

The functionality is not affected, but the display might be confusing. We should de-dupe this in the front-end

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: IP allowlisting appears twice in the pop-ul if both JSD and JSW are in Premium subscription

fields.description:
Currently when we claim a domain (domain.com) and apply a Security policy on it like SAML, Gsuite etc all users of the claimed domain are enforced to login with SSO.

It would be nice if the Org Admins have an ability to temporarily exclude users from SAML SSO which would help them Manage the users of the claimed domain in a more efficient way.
fields.summary: Ability to Exclude users from Single Sign On

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you verify a domain (but don't claim the accounts) and want to set up a security policy (e.g SAML), a message saying you need to verify a domain is displayed, even if you have already done that.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Verify a domain
 # Try to set up SAML

h3. Expected Results
A message saying you should claim the accounts should be displayed

h3. Actual Results
Instead, a message saying you need to verify the domain is displayed.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Improve Atlassian Access messages when the users hasn't claimed the accounts

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the *Reset Passwords* (part of the [Password policies|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/password-policies-938859739.html]) function to make [managed accounts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/managed-accounts-873871203.html] be logged out in 10 minutes, it will not track accounts being logged out. When users manually log out of their account in [https://id.atlassian.com,|https://id.atlassian.com%2C/] the following is displayed:

{quote}Logged out of account{quote}
 
h3.Feature Request

This is a suggestion to also include the time that the accounts were logged out using the *Reset passwords* feature so organization administrators will be able to confirm that the users were logged out indeed. 

It helps also making sure that newly applied policies will be already taking effect once the user log-in again.
fields.summary: Track users being logged out via password reset in the organization's audit logs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As an administrator, when attempting to view the profile picture from [managed accounts belonging to a verified domain|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/managed-accounts-873871203.html] at the organization, a default profile picture will be displayed if the user has one of the following configurations under the [Atlassian Account visibility settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/update-your-profile-and-visibility-settings-976161175.html]:

* Only you (which would be expected to not see the picture)
* Your organization (if the user's verified domain does not match with the domain of the org admin)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Make sure to have a [verified domain|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html] and existing Atlassian accounts belonging to it.
# As an administrator, access the managed accounts of the organization through *Directory* > *Managed accounts*.
# Select a profile by tapping the user's name from the list of managed accounts.

h3. Expected Results
The profile picture should be displayed as the visibility settings point to *Your organization*.

h3. Actual Results
The profile picture is displayed as a default avatar.

h3. Workaround
Have the users opening the profile picture to *Everyone* in the [profile visibility settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/update-your-profile-and-visibility-settings-976161175.html]. Alternatively, the org admin can [change the email to match the user's verified one|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/change-atlassian-account-email-addresses-969508513.html].
fields.summary: The profile picture is not visible at the organization if the visibility is allowed for the Organization level

fields.description:
With multiple products like bitbucket, trello moving to Atlassian Accounts, Org Admins need more granular details of the Managed users. Some of these details include:

1. Plan details of Trello users, whether they are on Free, Business, Enterprise etc
2. Site details (Jira and Confluence) where the user is currently an Active member of
3. Account creation Date

This would help the org admins get better control of the users and they can decide on whether to keep the users or deactivate them.
fields.summary: Ability to export detailed report of the Managed users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, when IP allowlisting enabled for the organization , user that using the correct IP and are not able to  access the "Portal Only Customer" page in User Management.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable IP allowlisting
 # Go to *User Management > JIRA Service Desk*


h3. Expected Results
Able to access "Portal only customer" page.

h3. Actual Results
Get error as below :-
 !image (6).png|thumbnail! 

In splunk log show the error below :-

{code}
{"code":403,"message":"The IP address has been rejected because it is not on the allowedlist. See your admin for more information."}
{code}

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Enabling IP allowlisting causing "Portal Only Customer" page in User Management not accessible

fields.description:
In Okta, when adding a push group, you have the option to either create a new push group or to select the "linked" option.
The linked option is intended to point back to groups in the app so that you can instantly sync groups to custom groups that you intend to overwrite.
fields.summary: Add support for "Linked" Push groups in the Okta integration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, when exporting organization members via the "Export Accounts" function under managed accounts, it includes the Atlassian accountId of these users in the third column. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Reorder the export list at org level to have Atlassian account id to appear in the first column instead of the third column. Given that it's the primary identifier and it would also be more consistent with site users export which includes Atlassian ID as the first column.
fields.summary: Reorder the export list at org level to have Atlassian account id to appear in the first column

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Introduce SAML APIs

h3. Suggested Solution
Customers need to update the certificates quarterly or disable SAML. This should be possible using APIs.

h3. Why this is important
Customers need the ability to manage the SAML configuration using APIs.
* Delete the configuration
* Update certificate
etc.
fields.summary: Introduce SAML APIs

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * It's possible for a single company to create multiple organizations and it isn't clear to admins how many organizations exist

h3. Suggested Solution
 * For customers who are not an Atlassian Access subscriber or users who want to claim a domain, have a banner on the Cloud instance or User Management page that has a link to the organization management page
 * Have a similar banner/verification on the Access subscription flow on [https://www.atlassian.com/software/access]
 * Link/display orgs. and admins that are on the same domain

h3. Why this is important
 * Creates added overhead and confusion for customers as it's not clear that each Cloud site has its own organization and customers may create a new(duplicate) one

h3. Workaround
 * Claim your domains/subscribe to access on your existing organization/organisation instead of the newly created organization. On the https://admin.atlassian.com/o/<org_id>/overview page, you can see which Cloud instances are associated with that particular organization
 * Please see: [Transfer products to another organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/transfer-products-to-another-organization-967318518.html] for instructions on how to move product between organizations
fields.summary: Highlight to org. admins that each Cloud instance has its own default organization

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Organization Admins who have configured Atlassian Access User Provisioning may not know of a Group Conflict Issue with provisioning until they view the User Provisioning details in their Organization 

h3. Suggested Solution
It may be helpful to send a notification to the Organization Admins letting them know that there is a Group Conflict and where to go to see more details about it in their Organization 

h3. Why this is important
It would help to increase the visibility of any errors/issues with User Provisioning when a New Group is pushed  

h3. Workaround 
Any Group Conflict Errors will be displayed within the Organization's User Provisioning settings
fields.summary: Send a Notification to Organization Admins When There is a User Provisioning Group Conflict

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Different from the past iteration, the domain claim, and account claim process is done in different steps to give to the admins better control over that delicate process, even when we confirm that the domain is claimed, the account claim will be pending.

That makes the current messages at the Org pages (i.e. Managed accounts, or SAML/User provisioning configuration page) obsolete:
!image.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solutions
Update the message to make it clear for the admins that they need to claim the accounts to be able to set up the integration i.e.:
{quote}
h4. *You need to claim your accounts*

To enforce SAML/User provisioning you must have managed accounts under this org.

*Claim accounts*
{quote}
fields.summary: Improve the Org pages' messages when the domain is already verified

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Setting up SAML Single sign on using Azure's browser extension leads to an incomplete setup. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Follow [Microsoft's Tutorial|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/saas-apps/atlassian-cloud-tutorial]
 # Use the *My Apps Secure Sign-in browser extension* to setup the integration
 # Complete the setup. 

h3. Expected Results

The configuration should complete and the admin can test the SAML login. 

h3. Actual Results

The configurations from Atlassian are not copied back to Azure making the setup incomplete. 

 !Screenshot #4.png|thumbnail! 

AADSTS700016 error is encountered on the login test. 

 !Screenshot #3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Follow the step by step method from [Microsoft's Tutorial|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/saas-apps/atlassian-cloud-tutorial] to fully setup the integration.
fields.summary: AADSTS700016 error when using the Azure browser extension

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Currently, it's only possible to set the session duration to pre-defined values that aren't configurable
* The minimum session duration value that can be currently set is 60 minutes and the maximum is 30 days

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow org. admins to set a custom value("custom" value option) and remove the minimum and maximum constraints for session durations, i.e. allow idle session durations of 15 minutes, 16 minutes or 47 minutes, etc.

h3. Why this is important
* Allow org. admins/organizations to define/set what exact session duration they need
* Many organizations have very specific requirements in regards to session duration, org. admins need the option to be able set 
 
h3. Workaround 
* No known workarounds.  A workaround will be added here if one is found
fields.summary: Session duration: Allow org. admins to set a custom session duration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a User's Role is change in a Cloud Site from "User" to "Trusted User", this event is not captured in the [Organization's Audit Log|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/audit-logging-970612562.html] 

A Timestamp is visible in the Site/Product System Audit Log when this change occurred, but it does not show what Site-Admin performed the action 

h3. Suggested Solution
Have the Organization Audit Log track the Role Change event and log details about who made the change, the timestamp, and the impacted User

h3. Why this is important
The Trusted User Role grants the User access to Jira Admin Features and it would need to be monitored when this access is granted 
 
h3. Workaround 
.
fields.summary: Track User Role Changes in Atlassian Access Organization Audit Log

fields.description:
This feature request is to add the ability for organization admins to set up a default avatar for users under their claimed domain, so that it is compliant to a certain organization's standards.

The request here is to enforce the usage of a specific avatar uploaded by the user if the account is managed by the specified domain.
fields.summary: default avatar image for users under claimed domain

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition 
Org admins are not able to inform users before applying any Atlassian Access security policy. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow org admins to send emails to users before applying any Atlassian Access security policy. 

h3. Why this is important
Org admins would like to inform the users before applying any policies in their regional/corporate language.
fields.summary: Allow org admins to send emails to users

fields.description:
{panel:title=Resolution update}
Hi All,

We've raised the limit to support a maximum of 10K users per group provisioned via SCIM.

Thank you,

Narmada Jayasankar

Lead Product Managed, Atlassian Access


{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Large/Enterprise Customers who are Configuring Atlassian Access with User Provisioning are running into an issue where User Provisioning will not create a Group if it contains more than 1000 Users

Error received:
{quote}Resource [Group] Exceeded group member limit of 1000 per group operation, please use additional group patch operations to add/replace/remove members
{quote}
h3. Suggested Solution

Expand the User Provisioning Group API so that more than 1k group operations can be received
h3. Why this is important

Large/Enterprise Customers may not be able to split their Group into smaller groups
h3. Workaround

For the initial sync, reduce the Group Membership to less than 1000 Users and push the Group. Once successful, add Users back to the Group in batches less than 1000 (eg 1-1000, 1001-2000, 2001-3000, etc)
fields.summary: Allow User Provisioning Groups Larger than 1000 in a Single Group Operation

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement
In the *Overview* and *Products* menu of the admin hub (https://admin.atlassian.com/), only Jira and Confluence are supported.

h3. Suggestion
Support other products, like Trello, Bitbucket, etc, so we can have shortcuts to those products as well.
fields.summary: Support other products in the Overview of the admin hub

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When [user provisioning|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/user-provisioning-959305316.html] is configured, an API token is created so that the Identity Provider can interact with our system to sync users and groups. 

Other than the person who created it or the admins that know how user provisioning works, it is not easy for the admins to know that that API is being used. Currently, is only displayed under https://admin.atlassian.com/ > *Directory* > *User provisioning* > *Directory* where you can revoke it by clicking on *Regenerate API key*. 

h3. Suggested Solutions
Make it easier for admins to know that the user provisioning API Key was created and it is currently in use (maybe displaying it at https://admin.atlassian.com/ > Settings > API Keys).

h3. Current options
- The API can be revoked at https://admin.atlassian.com/ > *Directory* > *User provisioning* > *Directory*. Note that this will prevent the identity provider to send updates to our end. 
- The admins can see who created the API at the https://admin.atlassian.com/ > *Security* > *Audit log* (filtering by _*Created user provisioning directory*_ or/and _*Regenerated API key for user provisioning*_).
- The [Org audit logs|https://www.atlassian.com/software/access/guide/elements/organization-audit-log#how-it-works] shows all the user provisioning related actions.
fields.summary: Improve the SCIM API visibility

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Customers have noticed that some Managed User Accounts do not show all of the User's associated Products in the Organization 

This can cause some issues or confusion with Atlassian Access licensing if a User appears to be managed with no Products 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View a User in Managed Accounts

h3. Expected Results
All Products associated to a User are shown 

h3. Actual Results

In this example, this User has access to and is active in Jira and Confluence: 
 !image-2020-08-26-12-41-28-265.png|thumbnail! 
however, when their Managed Account is viewed, it only shows Trello: 
 !image-2020-08-26-12-41-47-482.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

If the User has Product in a Cloud Site that is owned/managed by an Organization Administrator, view the User's Profile in the Site and toggle their Product Access
fields.summary: Managed Accounts Does Not Show All Associated Products

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Cloud, Premium users can work with the [IP allowlisting feature|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/ip-allowlisting-998658750.html], which allows specific IPs to access the site.

When a user is accessing Confluence from a whitelisted IP, it works perfectly, but, when the IP is removed from the list, by trying to access the site again, the following generic message is displayed:

{quote}
*Something went wrong*
Try refreshing the page. *Refresh*
If the problem persists, contact *Atlassian Support* or your space admin with the following details so they can locate and troubleshoot the issue:

This code: no72oq
The URL of this page

*Reload this page*
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an IP to the [IP allowlisting|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/ip-allowlisting-998658750.html].
# Have a user accessing Confluence from the whitelisted IP.
# Remove the added IP and have the user refreshing the page or accessing Confluence in a new tab.

h3. Expected Results
The following message should be displayed:

!403.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
A generic error message is displayed:

!wrong.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Accessing Confluence from an IP removed of the allowlist throws a generic error

fields.description:

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # See date & IP for lost of things, but not API use

h3. Expected Results

Show IP on User's token page (where they are revoked) OR

Show token access in Org audit logs just like login is captured today
h3. Actual Results
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Add last access IP/Geo info to API Token audit

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the option to bulk select all the managed accounts from an organization so they can be deactivated/reactivated, the list does not show all the users properly, like in the example below:

!accounts.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have an organization with more than 20 managed accounts (so it has more than one page for the list of accounts).
 # Tap the checkbox from the top left so it will select all the managed accounts.
!bulk.png|thumbnail!
 # Select *Deactivate* or *Reactivate*

h3. Expected Results

The provided list should properly display all the accounts.
h3. Actual Results

An empty/generic list is displayed. The link for each of the generic accounts would be pointing to the order of the account in the list, instead of the correct ID. For example:
{code:java}
https://admin.atlassian.com/o/ORG_ID/members/20 (this should be the user ID)
{code}
(i) Only the accounts from the page where the action has been done are displayed.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The list of all managed accounts to be bulk deactivated/reactivated does not retrieve the users properly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* When user provisioning(SCIM) is configured, users who are part of the sync group(s) will have Atlassian accounts automatically provisioned
* It is possible to allow users on approved domains to create their own Cloud accounts [Specify how users get site access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/specify-how-users-get-site-access-744721636.html#Specifyhowusersgetsiteaccess-Approveddomains]
* In this scenario, admins provision users via their identity provider and end-users are able to create their own site and Atlassian accounts
* This can create confusion for both the user and the admin
* The admin will see users created who are not part of any sync groups and are not managed by the provisioning sync, e.g. if the user's account is deactivated on identity provider side, the Cloud site and Atlassian account are not deactivated
* For existing users, and when SCIM is configured, users should not be able to request access to additional products as some customers have the expectation that only the identity provider admin should control product access via SCIM
* End-users who invite themselves to the site are not managed by the identity provider and may increase the license count for a Cloud site
* If SAML is configured, end-users may sign up for site access, but then are unable to log in due to their identity provider account having the correct level of permissions to log in via SAML

h3. Suggested Solution
* Warn admins that site access/approved domain settings are enabled and/or deactivate any site or domain access settings when SCIM/provisioning is enabled
* Additionally - as part of the solution, there should be a way to block/deactivate the feature which allows _existing_ users to request access to products they do not have access to - [CLOUD-11002|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CLOUD-11002]

h3. Why this is important
* Having both provisioning and site access settings enabled causes confusion for both end-users and admins
 
h3. Workaround 
* Manually remove any domains from the "Approved domains" section of the site access settings
fields.summary: When SCIM/provisioning is configured, deactivate the Site access settings for approved domains which match the user provisioned domains

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The SAML givenName and surName attributes are currently prioritized over the SCIM DisplayName Attribute and when a User SAML Authenticates, their Atlassian account Full Name is updated and overwritten with the SAML Value
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ACCESS-747

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the "Atlassian Cloud" OIN App in Okta so that the givenName/surName SAML Attribute mappings can be customized

h3. Why this is important
Users may prefer their Nickname/DisplayName that is sent via SCIM instead of their givenName
 
h3. Workaround 
This may not be practical/viable as other Apps integrated with Okta use the same User Profile Details, update the User's Profile in Okta so that their Nickname is sent as their givenName/surName

Alternatively, you can configure SAML in atlassian using a generic app in Okta in addition to the "Atlassian Cloud" app (for SCIM) by simply changing the SAML settings in Atlassian to point to the new generic app in Okta.
This trades-off the ability to have both a Jira and a Confluence button in Okta for the ability to disable the givenName/surName attributes in SAML.
Please note that the email address for the nameId needs to use the same user property as the SCIM configuration used by the "Atlassian Cloud" app.
fields.summary: Allow Customers to Customize the Given/SurName SAML Attributes in Okta App

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The domain verification CSV export is not showing Trello users before claiming accounts which may cause a huge discrepancy on expectations vs reality for billing or SSO integration planning.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Having users with only Trello as a product, start the domain verification process.
 # With the domain verified, download the CSV export of future managed users.
 # Claim the accounts.

h3. Expected Results

The information from the CSV export before claiming the accounts should list all possibly managed accounts.
h3. Actual Results

After claiming the accounts, more users will show up as managed accounts because of the Trello accounts that were previously unmanaged.
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: The domain verification CSV export is not showing Trello users before claiming accounts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
UNSUBSCRIBE is not displayed properly in non-English languages at the [Organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/organization-administration-938859734.html] while trying to unsubscribe from Access.

Confirmed with German and French.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have the browser's language set to German(as an example)
# Access https://admin.atlassian.com/ > select the org > *Billing* > *Atlassian Access* > *...* > *Unsubscribe*
# You will see the following screen:
!image.png|thumbnail!

Translating that message above the text box from Deutsch to English:
{quote}
If you want to continue anyway, give below
{quote}
The page doesn't give any clue about what to do next. 
 

h3. Expected Results
The message there should be clear like we see in English:
!image1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
!image.png|thumbnail!

If you inspect the code you can see the message:
!dev.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Type UNSUBSCRIBE at the text box to get the option to proceed:
!image2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Admins can't easily unsubscribe from Access when the browser's language is not English

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Some customers may want to add different users to different cloud site based on their geographic locations

h3. Suggested Solution
*  Introduce the feature to allow users to be provisioned to a cloud site based to the location

h3. Why this is important
* There are many cloud sites that may be created for various locations of a company. The customer would like to provision users to the cloud sites based on the location of the users.
fields.summary: Provision users based on the geographic location

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user logs in via SAML, the _audit log_ in the organization does not capture the *real* IP address of the user, but rather an Amazon CloudFront IP address, most likely part of the authentication process

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure SAML for an organization
 # Ask a user in the managed domain to log in. Also ask the user for their computer's IP address
# Check the Audit log for the _user login_ event.
# Notice that the IP address is not the same as the user's IP address

h3. Expected Results
The user's IP address is captured and logged

h3. Actual Results
A different IP address is captured in the logs, most likely part of the authentication process

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Organization's audit log captures the incorrect IP address when users log in via SAML

fields.description:
When using the Atlassian-created Okta application, the values selected by default for the nameID for SAML uses the Okta username. The SCIM email setting uses the primary email by default.
Given that these values need to always match in order to function, I would like to suggest setting the defaults to always use the user email and not to use the Okta Username as the default for both.
If possible, I would also like to suggest a way to link the two values to be from the same attribute or set them independently if needed.
fields.summary: Okta App does not keep the same attribute to use for Email address between SAML and SCIM

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Currently for partners/organization admins, it's difficult to obtain the Atlassian Access SEN
* The billing contact(s) may not be the partner or organization admin, so they need to rely on other people to obtain the SEN
* This can be problematic when raising a support case with Atlassian Support where the contact form asks for a SEN.  The lack of a SEN can delay the support process

h3. Suggested Solution
* Include the SEN on the "Billing overview" for the Atlassian Access subscription for an organization

h3. Why this is important
* Partners and organization admins may not have easy access to invoices
* It's time consuming for partners or organization admins
 
h3. Workaround 
* Goto https://my.atlassian.com to retrieve SEN information
* Obtain the SEN from the invoices for the Atlassian Access subscription - billing contacts usually have access to the invoices
fields.summary: Include the Atlassian Access SEN on the Billing management/overview page in the Access(organization) UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User details (ie. Product access) in Organization and Site level can show different result sometime.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Claim the domain and go to Manage Account and open one of the accounts
 #* https://admin.atlassian.com/o/<Org ID>/members
 # Go to User Management page (site level) and open the same user account.
 #* https://admin.atlassian.com/s/<Site ID>/users/<user AID>

h3. Expected Results

The product access information should be the same.
h3. Actual Results

The user shows that he doesn't have any product access from Organization level (Managed Account page), while he actually is granted with one (from User Management page).

h3. Workaround

Contact [Atlassian support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact]
fields.summary: User details in Organization and Site level can be out of sync

An organization admin cannot modify the public name at [https://admin.atlassian.com/] while the REST API accepts update requests.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Forcing a password reset for an organization with more than one claimed domain fails.

h3. Environment
Organization with more than 1 domain claimed

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a site.
 # Create and organization.
 # Claims at least 2 domains.  
 # Try to force password reset using the below screen:
 !Screenshot 2019-07-03 at 14.50.25.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Expected Results
The users who are part of the organization should be logged out after 10min and force to reset their password on login. 

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens, the users are not logged out and no password reset is required. 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Forcing a password reset for an organization with more than one claimed domain fails.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When verifying a domain, if this fails for any reason, the UI always shows the same error message saying 'Please make the verification file available here: [https://domain_to_verify.com/atlassian-domain-verification.html|https://pliancy.com/atlassian-domain-verification.html]'.

!Pasted_Image_27_01_17_09_45.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

The verification may fail for different reasons, including SSL certificate compliance. It would be helpful to get a more specific error message shown rather than a generic message that can be misleading as the file can be already available in the requested URL.
fields.summary: Show a more meaningful error when domain verification fails

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

With the introduction of 2FA, if this is set as active, all users will be enforced to use it, regardless of the IP address they are coming from.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to bypass 2FA when logging in via certain IP addresses previously added to the settings.
fields.summary: Allow users within an IP range to not to be enforced to 2FA

fields.description: It would be a useful feature if the admins of managed Bitbucket Cloud accounts could disable their own users to create repositories on their managed Bitbucket Cloud accounts.
fields.summary: Disabling managed users to create repositories on their own account

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, when exporting organization members via the "Export Accounts" function under managed accounts, it does not include Atlassian accountId of these users. Atlassian account ID is needed when organization members need to be enabled/disabled in bulk.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the Ability to include the account IDs when exporting organization members via the "Export Accounts" function under managed accounts. This functionality is already available when exporting the users at a site level.
h3. Workaround

Fetching the organization members via REST API will help with the Atlassian account ID of these users, however, it returns 50 users at a time:
 * [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/#api-orgs-orgId-users-get]

In this case, you need to use the *cursor* parameter to do the pagination.

 !image-2020-07-15-15-37-31-395.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to include the account IDs when exporting organization members via the "Export Accounts" function under managed accounts

fields.description:
h3. Problem
If you enforce SSO to your users through Azure, for example, and they use the social login "Continue with Microsoft", they will not log in with SAML, instead, they will use a specific flow. 

 !connectionMicrosoft.png|thumbnail! 

As a result, a new app will be created at your Azure enterprise apps, called "Atlassian", and the user will be assigned to that app.

h3. Suggestion
Integrate the social login functionality with the SAML implementation, so when the user clicks that button, the system automatically recognizes he is a SAML user.

h3. Workaround
For now, users should use the email to trigger the SAML authentication flow
fields.summary: As an org admin, I want that the social login uses the SAML flow to authenticate users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Deactivated/ Removed Gsuite user gets recreated post Trello Account migration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Gsuite Admin removes/deactivates the user in Gsuite (user no longer exists on Gsuite)
 # User is no longer part of the G-synced groups 
# Trello users are migrated to Atlassian Accounts if the domain has been claimed by Atlassian (via Gsuite in this case)
# These users get recreated as Active users on Atlassian Org
# There is no way for the Org Admin to Deactivate/Delete these users from Atlassian Org as it gives the error "The account is managed by Identity Provider"

h3. Expected Results
There should be an option to Deactivate/ Delete these invalid accounts on Atlassian

h3. Actual Results

Deactivate/Delete button greyed out as Atlassian thinks the account is managed by Gsuite


h3. Workaround

Contact support to get these users deleted
fields.summary: Deactivated/ Removed Gsuite user gets recreated post Trello Account migration

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Org admin verifies domain sample.com
# Org admin deactivates abc@sample.com
# Org admin removes domain sample.com
# A site admin invites abc@sample.com to site

h3. Expected Results
abc@sample.com cannot access the site, however they can re-activate their account by themselves

h3. Actual Results
abc@sample.com cannot access the site, also they cannot re-activate their account by themselves

h3. Suggested Solution
* When the org admin tries to remove the domain claim, show a warning dialog with a list of the deactivated users and an option to enable them
* If the domain is not claimed anymore, provide deactivated users an option to re-activate their account by themselves

h3. Workaround
Org admin can re-verify the domain and enable the afffected user. Note that re-verifying the domain re-claiming the user triggers a bulk email to all the users with the same domain
fields.summary: No workaround for deactivated users after removing domain claim, other than re-verifying the domain

At this moment, the sites linked to an organization have provisioned users added to them automatically. Customers should have the ability to remove the users from the site without them being added back automatically due to user provisioning being enabled.

fields.description:
Our current SCIM API rate-limit is preventing customers that provision their users to do the initial cycle timely.

This is especially true for customers that use Azure. Azure is sending one request for each user. If 86 users are members of a group - 86 requests to put each user in the group. There is no batching. Additionally, when too many HTTP 429 statuses are received by Azure, Microsoft quarantines the customer's Azure instance to only one request every 24 hours. 

The real solution for this problem would be for Azure to use batching, but in the meantime, raising this feature request to have some sort of feature flag per directoy or per organization to have the limit increased. This could be a useful workaround.

This would greatly benefit customers migrating from Server as they have a tight deadline in their migration schedule.
fields.summary: Provide a feature flag to increase the SCIM API rate-limit

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an Atlassian Access subscription gets expired due to lack of payment, if the user tries to resubscribe to it, a "*Network error*" message is displayed, instead of pointing the user that payment should be added:

!network.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*Subscribe to an Atlassian Access subscription*
# As an organization administrator, go to https://admin.atlassian.com
# Go to *Billing* and tap *Manage subscriptions*
# Tap the *Subscribe* option.
# Make sure to not add any payment details through the *Billing details* part.
# Once the Atlassian Access is expired and the subscription is over, go back to *Manage subscriptions*
# Tap the *Resubscribe* button

h3. Expected Results
A message stating that a payment method is required should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
A "Network error" message is displayed.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Resubscribing to an expired Atlassian Access subscription fails without proper advice

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The _Organization_ field synced through the [SCIM integration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/user-provisioning-959305316.html] is not displayed for the admins at the [Organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/organization-administration-938859734.html] level.

h3. Suggested Solutions
Ensure that the _Organization_ and all the supported (Display name, Email address, Job title, Timezone, Department, Preferred language) fields are displayed to the admins at the Org when they exist at the external directory.
fields.summary: Add Organization SCIM attributes to the Managed Accounts profile UI

fields.description:
Preceding and trailing spaces are sometimes very difficult to spot and can cause a lot of time wasted in debugging a SAML issue. Support had issues where more than half a day was spent on investigating a SAML configuration issue caused by a preceding space.

Also, there is no valid reason to have a preceding or a trailing space in any of the SAML parameters.

Please configure the front-end to automatically strip them off
fields.summary: Automatically remove preceding and trailing spaces in SAML configuration parameters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Nowadays, site-admins can raise tickets and grants access to Jira in the support Atlassian tickets. We would like to delimit this permission for org-admins.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # access to getsupport.atlassian.com and open a support ticket
 # site-admin can grant access

h3. Current Results

site-admin can grant access
h3. Expected Results

site-admin shouldn't grant access without org-admin permission.
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Allow org-admins specify who can raise support tickets on Atlassian Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When an org admin disables enforced 2FA, the 2FA configuration is still present and can be deleted from https://id.atlassian.com. When the org admin enables SSO for users, 2FA should be removed for users overall.

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove 2FA other org policies for users overall when SSO is enabled by an org admin.

h3. Why this is important
Customers do not want 2FA, other org policies and SSO to be coexisting for users.

1. Given SAML SSO is enabled, if the org admin opts to enable 2FA (in addition to SAML SSO), supress (DO NOT SEND) 2FA action required email notification to all managed users, because when they follow the link in the email to take action it takes them to a page advising their account is already managed and they cannot make any changes relating to 2FA anyway, this causes confusion for end users and leads to unnecessary support calls.
2. Given SAML SSO is enabled, all settings on the Org admin Password management (/passwordpolicy) page, could be disabled. Changes to these settings while SAML SSO is enabled have no effect on the password policy, since password policy management is entirely delegated to the SAML SSO IDM when SAML SSO is enabled. There should at least be a message in the "What you need to know" panel on this page to highlight that these settings have no effect when SAML SSO is enabled.
fields.summary: When SAML SSO is enabled, all settings on the Org admin Password management (/passwordpolicy) page, could be disabled

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when _*Atlassian Access*_ subscription is not automatically renewed due to payment issues, the [user provisioning|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/user-provisioning-959305316.html] directory is deleted. The groups that were being synced become Jira internal groups to preserve the access the users have to the site (when that is configured for the synced groups by [adding them to the default product access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/update-product-access-settings-744721629.html]) and so that they can be editable on the application. 

This causes a huge impact for the system administrators that needs to reenable that integration again as there is a limitation where you can't sync groups with the same name. Beyond that, some IdPs keep a reference for the old users' ids demanding a cleanup on their end.

h3. Suggested Solutions
Create a mechanism to keep that directory information that requires a manual deletion from the Org admins to reduce the steps needed to make that integration working again.
fields.summary: Don't delete the SCIM directory when Access subscription is revoked.

fields.description:
h2. Summary

If Organisation admin makes changes to a user profile via Organisation UI:
 * Full name
 * Job title change
 * Department
 * Based in
 * Profile picture

These changes are not shown in Audit log of an organisation.

Request to add user profile change to an audit log of an organisation.
fields.summary: Add details to audit log about changes of user's profile via Organisation UI

fields.description:
This is coming out of a discussion with eco-system and Identity teams on misuse of api token.

Eventually ecosystem decide on the overall strategy around API token usage. But before that,  we should be able to at least have the information on api token access. Admin need to at least be able to know what resources api token accessed at what time.
Suggest event to be include:
api token creation/deletion
api token access resource

This work will need both identity and Admin Experience team's effort. So this ticket is for Admin Experience side of work

Hope this is the right place for it.
fields.summary: Ability to have api token related event in audit log

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is possible to claim domain in the Organisation using "www" prefix.
 Once domain is verified with "www" prefix, you cannot see any users in "managed accounts" list.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In your organisation, claim domain with "www" prefix. For example, "www.example.com"
 # Make sure it is verified and check list of managed accounts

h3. Expected Results

Managed accounts list in your organisation shows all users that have verified Atlassian Accounts from domain @example.com 
h3. Actual Results

Managed accounts list in your organisation is empty.
h3. Workaround

Need to remove verified "www.example.com" domain and verify domain _without_ "www" prefix.
fields.summary: Claiming domain with "www" prefix doesn't show managed accounts list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
CSV export of managed accounts of an Organization are resulting in wrong value for *Last active date* (01/01/1970) if the users are on status *Pending* on the Trello account migration towards Atlassian Account. 

The CSV generating process is prioritizing this date rather than the general one displayed in the UI of the Org Administration. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As an Org Admin, access https://admin.atlassian.com/ 
 # Select the respective Org
 # Head to *Directory* 
 # Then select *Managed Accounts*
 # Have at least one managed account with the status pending on the Trello migration account process.
 # Export the list of users via CSV through the button *Export Accounts*

h3. Expected Results
 # *Last Active Date* should be either empty if not seen in the site or filled in with the value of the latest seen time of a product the account has access to.

h3. Actual Results
# *Last Active Date* has the value 01/01/1970 in the CSV even though it's displayed as *Unavailable* through the UI for Trello.

h3. Workaround
Manually replace in the CSV all the cells that contain the value 01/01/1970 by an empty value.
fields.summary: CSV Export of Managed Accounts results in inconsistent Last Active Date value

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Introduce a feature to use Atlassian Access SAML configuration to authenticate users for other custom-built applications.

h3. Suggested Solution
The customer would like to use the SAML configuration in the organization to authenticate users to other custom-built applications.

h3. Why this is important
Customers having the same set of users can use the SAML configuration in the Atlassian organization to authenticate users for custom-built applications.
fields.summary: Introduce a feature to use Atlassian Access SAML configuration to authenticate users for other custom built applications

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, Org Admins don't have a singular UI page to track API Tokens created by managed users. There also isn't any way to log or track when API Tokens are created by managed users as well.

h3. Suggested Solution
Integrate API Token creation/management with the audit log, and include a singular dashboard for all API Tokens created by managed users.

h3. Why this is important
This allows for Org Admins to have a singular page to manage API Tokens, instead of having to browse to each individual user. This is helpful when managing larger numbers of users.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Improve overall API Token management/logging

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When the X.509 SAML public certificate expires:

Users receive an error message this is too generic

There is not way for an organization admin to proactively know that this certificate will soon expire or is already expired.

h3. Suggested Solution

Capture and display the status of the certificate if it is about to expire or is already expired to organization admins and provide a more specific error message to users.

h3. Workaround
Manually check that your X.509 SAML public certificate is expired.

{panel:title=Original request}When a public certificate used for SAML is expired, the error that users get is too generic, mentioning only that "there seems to be an issue with the SAML public key.

In the case of certificate expiry, we should capture this event and provide a more specific error message, informing the user about the expiry of the certificate.{panel}
fields.summary: better error message for SAML certificate expired

fields.description:
h4.Current Scenario

When an organization has verified domain, by going to *admin.atlassian.com* > *User directory* > *Managed accounts*, it is possible to add characters to search for users.

When searching for users, multiple results will be displayed instead of only the ones matching with the specific search. As explained in the [Managed accounts article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/administer-managed-accounts-for-an-organization-873871203.html?_cachebust=8947658411] the search criteria works based on 3  characters:

{quote}
From the *Managed accounts* page, you can search accounts by name and email address. When your search criteria is more than 3 characters, we return results that match at least 3 continuous characters in your search criteria in addition to results that include the full string.
{quote}

h4.Suggestion

When an organization has multiple accounts, putting the full email of a user will return a lot of results that can cause confusion for scenarios where for some reason, the account is not displayed or scenarios where it is necessary to filter single results.

This is a suggestion to either:

# Update the search to work based on single results matching the search criteria, like the [user management for Atlassian Cloud instances|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-your-users-744721645.html].
# Include a dropdown to allow the search type to be used (single or multiple results). By allowing the administrator to select the type of search to use, it would make the product more flexible and meet a broader range of needs.
fields.summary: Improve/provide alternatives for "Managed Accounts" search

fields.description:
{panel:title= Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Atlassian Access doesn't pass the device information to the IdPs. As a result, the device-based conditional access control (such as [*Conditional Access - Require compliant devices* - Azure Active Directory|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/conditional-access/howto-conditional-access-policy-compliant-device]) doesn't work.
h3. Suggested Solution

Include device information to the redirecting request towards IdPs where possible.
h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Support "require compliant devices" of Azure AD

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* The [SAML single sign-on|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/saml-single-sign-on-943953302.html] documentation states:
{quote}
Before configuring SAML single sign-on, create an Atlassian account that you can use to access your organization even if SAML has been mis-configured. This account:

* must not use an email address from a domain you have verified for this organization. This ensures that the account will not redirect to SAML single sign-on when you log in.
* must be given both site admin and organization admin access.
{quote}
* Organization admins can be locked out in the event that there are issues with the SAML configuration

h3. Suggested Solution
* Add a validator that _reminds_ org. admins to add/check for a org. + site admin that is on an unclaimed domain when they are about to complete the SAML configuration

h3. Why this is important
* SAML configurations affect all users on claimed domains
* Admins can be locked out of the Access UI if there is a SAML issue
 
h3. Workaround 
* No known workarounds for a validator
fields.summary: When configuring SAML, add a validator that checks to see if there is an organization + site admin on an unclaimed domain

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * The [SAML Single sign-on|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/saml-single-sign-on-943953302.html] documentation states:
{quote}Before configuring SAML single sign-on, create an Atlassian account that you can use to access your organization even if SAML has been mis-configured. This account:
 * must not use an email address from a domain you have verified for this organization. This ensures that the account will not redirect to SAML single sign-on when you log in.
 * must be given both site admin and organization admin access.{quote}
 * Organization admins can be locked out and would be forced to contact [Atlassian Cloud Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/] if there are

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Add a validator that _reminds_ org. admins before they complete the SAML configuration that they may want to add a site + org. admin that is on an unclaimed domain

h3. Why this is important
 * In case there are any configuration issues, org. admins will still be able to go back in and resolve issues
 * SAML configuration affects all users on a claimed domain

h3. Workaround
 * No known workarounds for a validator
fields.summary: When configuring SAML, add a validator to check if an unclaimed domain is an organization admin

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
API token dates showing 'Invalid Date' on managed accounts profiles instead of the dates. 
It shows ok on users' profiles at https://id.atlassian.com/manage/api-tokens.

Bug in the org view
 !bugview.png|thumbnail! 

User view is ok
 !userview.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Logged in as an end-user with a managed account, create an API token at https://id.atlassian.com/manage/api-tokens
# Use that token at least once (_see example on the Notes section_)
# Logged in as an org admin, go to the user above profile and check the API section

h3. Expected Results
It should show the correct dates

h3. Actual Results
It shows 'Invalid Date' on both Last access and Created on.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h2. Notes
- API example to use as a test
{code:sql| borderColor=#2E86C1}
curl -D- \
   -u user@email.com:token \
   -X GET \
   -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
   https://your-domain.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta
{code}
- The payload apparently returns the values correctly
 !payload.png|thumbnail! 
Converting the values from epoch to human readable they're correct.
 !datesconverted.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: API token dates showing 'Invalid Date' on managed accounts profiles

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When setting browser language to "German" , some part of User Management wordings translated to German. However, most of it still displaying in English causing a mixture of language in User Management

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set browser language to German
 # Access to User Management

h3. Expected Results
All wordings in User Management converted in German language.

h3. Actual Results
Most of the part still displaying in English :-
 !Screenshot 2020-03-20 at 9.33.28 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Setting Browser language to "German" doesn't fully translate the User Management

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Organization administrators would like to be able to load users from more than 50 domains under the Managed Accounts. Currently, the list is not being loaded.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow the organization UI to display managed accounts if there are more than 50 domains claimed
* As there is a hard-coded limit on displayed domains, provide a message in the organization UI advising administrators of this limitation

h3. Why this is important
* Organization administrators need to be able to search for users across all their domains
* Filtering by individual domains isn't an efficient way of searching
 
h3. Workaround 
* To get a full list of all users and account details, take an export of the Managed accounts list via Directory > Managed accounts; Export users
* Filter the Managed accounts list by individual domains using the available select field for domains
fields.summary: Increase the number of domain verifications to over than 50

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Some admins have users logging in using social login (*Continue with Google*) or the default (Atlassian email and password) but they can't see which option the user uses. 

h3. Suggested Solutions
Add to the [Org audit log|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/audit-logging-970612562.html] the method the user used to authenticate.
fields.summary: Allow Org admins to see which authentication method the users used to authenticate at Atlassian

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

With change to Trello, Bitbucket and Statuspage Accounts being managed in an Atlassian Organization, Administrators would like for their users to IdP Initiated login to these applications.

In Okta, chiclet/buttons are utilized to initiate IdP login to Apps
h3. Why this is important

There is not an option to display a JSM Customer Portal/Trello/Bitbucket/Statuspage chiclet/button with the "Atlassian Cloud" App (it currently supports Jira and Confluence); this can lead to confusion for Users that only have access to these products.
h3. Suggested Solution

Update the "Atlassian Cloud" App in Okta to add a link to Trello, Bitbucket and Statuspage products for IdP Initiated login.
h3. Workaround
 - Users can SP initiated login by going to [https://trello.com/login]
 - Okta Admins can add a [Bookmark App|https://support.okta.com/help/s/article/How-do-you-create-a-bookmark-app] for SP initiated logins to [https://trello.com/login] or [https://trello.com/appSwitcherLogin] or [https://manage.statuspage.io/cloud/<cloudId>|https://manage.statuspage.io/cloud/%3CcloudId%3E]
 - Create a [Bookmark App|https://support.okta.com/help/s/article/How-do-you-create-a-bookmark-app] to start.atlassian.com, and then users can choose which product that they would like to proceed to after a SP initiated login.
fields.summary: Update Atlassian Cloud App in Okta to include Trello, Bitbucket and Statuspage Chiclets

fields.description:
There is no ability to display a list of users managed externally via Atlassian Access against those managed otherwise (i.e. SCIM-managed vs Managed Accounts vs non-managed).

The workaround to *Export accounts* in the *Managed accounts* screen as a CSV and going through the list of users is not ideal and time-consuming.

Please provide an option to display differently managed users.
fields.summary: Display list of users managed externally via Atlassian Access

fields.description:
The [User provisioning|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/user-provisioning-959305316.html] troubleshooting section should have a new row covering "what if a user is not syncing"(or similar):
As per the default mappings, a mail attribute is required or the provisioning sync will not work - a user needs to have a mailbox.  The value of the mail user attribute in Azure AD is only populated if the user has a Microsoft Exchange Mailbox.  If the user doesn't have a mailbox, the user mappings will need to be updated to use a different attribute that is mapped to the emails attribute in Atlassian Cloud.
fields.summary: Documentation update: Users don't sync if the mappings are not correct

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It's not possible to use the 'tab' key to select the tabs on the "User provisioning" page on the organization admin hub.  It doesn't seem to be possible to select any of the tabbed items - "Groups", "Product access", "Directory", "Troubleshooting log".
 !Screenshot 2020-02-27 at 20.56.34.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to "User provisioning"
 # Use the 'tab' key to try and select one of the tabs

h3. Expected Results
* "Groups", "Product access", "Directory", "Troubleshooting log" tabs are selectable without using a mouse/trackpad

h3. Actual Results
* Tabs are not accessible without using a mouse/trackpad

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Accessibility: It's not possible to use the 'tab' key to navigate on the "User provisioning" page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the NVDA screen reader, certain pages in the organization admin do not work.  Those pages are:
* Provisioning
* SAML
* Password management
* Two-step verification

All other pages are read by the software without any issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install NVDA
# Navigate around the organization admin pages

h3. Expected Results
The screen elements are read by the NVDA software.

h3. Actual Results
* Screen reading software doesn't work on the following pages
** Provisioning
** SAML
** Password management
** Two-step verification


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Accessibility: NVDA screen reader doesn't work on certain pages

fields.description:
In relation to JRACLOUD-73346, it would be a good feature if the Atlassian Account attributes can be used within Jira. 

From provisioning perspective, it would be a good feature to allow custom attributes from third party IDPs to be synced into the Atlassian Accounts. 

Sample Use Case :

- Azure accounts have the Manager attributes. 
- Sync this attribute to the Atlassian Accounts
- JSD approvals automatically sets to the user's Manager
fields.summary: Custom attributes for SCIM User Provisioning
